Name: 1Password
Description: Another leading password manager offering secure password generation, storage, and sharing capabilities with robust security features.

Name: Acronis Cyber Protect
Description: Acronis combines backup, antivirus, and endpoint management into a single solution with customizable scheduling for automated backups.

Name: Acronis Cyber Protect Cloud
Description: Acronis combines backup, disaster recovery, and cybersecurity into a single, integrated platform for comprehensive data protection.

Name: After Incident Report (GitHub)
Description: A simple, open-source template to standardize post-incident reports within a GitHub repository.

Name: Alation Data Catalog
Description: Alation's catalog automatically discovers, profiles, and catalogs data across your organization to provide a searchable inventory with business context.

Name: Amazon Certificate Manager (ACM)
Description: Easily provisions, manages, and deploys public and private SSL/TLS certificates for use with AWS services.

Name: Amazon S3 Glacier Deep Archive
Description: Offers extremely low-cost archival storage with a retrieval time of 12-48 hours, suitable for long-term data retention that eventually needs secure deletion.

Name: Amazon S3 Lifecycle Policies
Description: Configure automated data tiering and deletion rules for objects stored in Amazon S3 based on age or other criteria.

Name: Amazon TimeSync Service (AWS)
Description: Provides highly accurate time synchronization for AWS resources using Precision Time Protocol (PTP).

Name: Amazon VPC (Virtual Private Cloud)
Description: Enables the creation of isolated virtual networks within AWS, allowing for dedicated computing resources without internet access.

Name: Amazon Web Services (AWS) - Multiple AWS Accounts
Description: Utilize distinct AWS accounts to isolate production and non-production environments, providing strong logical separation and resource control.

Name: Android Enterprise - Google Play for Work
Description: This service allows organizations to manage Android devices, including utilizing work profiles that create a separate workspace for enterprise applications and data.

Name: Ansible
Description: Simplifies network automation through playbooks that define desired states, ensuring consistent and secure network configurations across devices.

Name: Ansible Automation Platform
Description: Enables automated software deployment, configuration management, and application lifecycle management with secure SSH-based communication.

Name: Apple System Integrity Protection (SIP)
Description: SIP is a core security feature built into macOS that protects system processes and files from unauthorized modification, significantly reducing the attack surface for exploits.

Name: AppLocker (Microsoft)
Description: AppLocker allows administrators to control which applications and scripts users can run by specifying rules based on file paths, publishers, or file hashes.

Name: Aqua Security
Description: This platform provides security throughout the entire application lifecycle, including container scanning and vulnerability management to minimize infrastructure attack surface.

Name: Aruba ClearPass Policy Manager
Description: Aruba's ClearPass offers policy management and access control with support for 802.1X, WPA3 Enterprise, and other secure protocols across wired and wireless networks.

Name: Asset Panda
Description: Asset Panda offers a mobile-first asset tracking platform for managing physical and digital assets with customizable fields and reporting features.

Name: Atlan
Description: Atlan is a modern data workspace that includes data cataloging capabilities to help you discover, understand, and trust your data assets.

Name: Atlassian Jira Service Management
Description: While not solely an incident response tool, Jira Service Management can be customized to manage incidents, track progress, and facilitate communication within a defined process.

Name: AuditBoard Cloud Platform
Description: Streamlines audit workflows, allowing for continuous monitoring of service provider controls and documentation.

Name: AuditBoard Vendor Management
Description: AuditBoard streamlines the vendor management process with automated assessments, documentation, and reporting for continuous compliance.

Name: Auditd (Linux)
Description: A built-in Linux auditing system that allows for detailed tracking of system calls, including those from the command line.

Name: Auth0
Description: A flexible identity platform allowing developers to easily add authentication and authorization to applications with centralized user accounts.

Name: Automox
Description: Automox provides automated patching, configuration management, and vulnerability remediation across all operating systems and devices.

Name: Autoruns (Sysinternals)
Description: This free utility from Microsoft allows users to view and disable various startup programs, including those triggered by removable media.

Name: AWS Backup
Description: AWS Backup centrally manages backups across various AWS services, with encryption options to safeguard recovery data.

Name: AWS CloudTrail
Description: A service that records API calls made to AWS resources, which can include URL requests if those URLs are accessed through AWS services.

Name: AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM)
Description: Provides centralized control over AWS resources by defining granular permissions for users and groups.

Name: AWS Key Management Service (KMS)
Description: AWS KMS enables you to easily create and control cryptographic keys used to encrypt your data at rest.

Name: AWS Lake Formation
Description: This service builds a secure data lake by centralizing governance and security policies across your data, enabling you to control access based on sensitivity levels.

Name: AWS Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA)
Description: Enforces MFA for AWS accounts to protect against unauthorized access.

Name: AWS Network Firewall
Description: A managed cloud firewall service that simplifies the process of deploying, configuring, and managing firewalls in AWS environments.

Name: AWS Network Manager
Description: AWS Network Manager provides centralized visibility and management of your hybrid network infrastructure, simplifying updates and ensuring consistent configurations.

Name: AWS S3 Glacier Deep Archive
Description: This service provides extremely low-cost, offline storage for infrequently accessed data, offering isolation from primary systems.

Name: AWS Systems Manager Automation
Description: Allows you to automate operational tasks like applying security patches and hardening configurations on AWS resources.

Name: AWS Web Application Firewall (WAF)
Description: A managed service that protects web applications from common attacks, providing application layer filtering at scale.

Name: Azure Active Directory (Azure AD)

Name: Azure Archive Storage

Name: Azure Backup

Name: Azure Disk Encryption

Name: Azure Firewall

Name: Azure Monitor Logs

Name: Azure Network Watcher

Name: Azure Security Benchmark (formerly CIS Azure Foundations Benchmark)

Name: Azure Site Recovery

Name: Azure Virtual Network

Name: BeyondTrust Privileged Remote Access

Name: BIND (Berkeley Internet Domain Name Server)

Description: A comprehensive password management solution with features like secure sharing, breach monitoring, and compliance reporting.

Name: Kenna Security (now Cisco XDR)

Name: Keycloak
Description: An open-source identity and access management solution enabling SSO and centralized authentication across applications.

Name: KillDisk

Name: KnowBe4
Description: Offers a comprehensive platform with simulated phishing campaigns, training modules, and reporting features to educate users on recognizing various attack types.

Name: Lansweeper
Description: Lansweeper offers automated network discovery and software inventory reporting for comprehensive asset visibility.

Name: LastPass
Description: A popular password manager that generates strong, unique passwords and securely stores them across devices.

Name: Let's Encrypt
Description: Provides free TLS certificates to enable HTTPS encryption for websites.

Name: Little Snitch (macOS)
Description: This macOS application monitors all network connections made by applications and prompts the user to allow or deny them, effectively creating a default-deny firewall.

Name: Living Security
Description: Uses interactive storytelling and gamified training to engage employees and teach them how to identify and avoid social engineering attacks.

Name: LogicGate
Description: A risk management software platform that allows for the creation of custom vendor assessment questionnaires and tracking of remediation efforts.

Name: LogicGate Ncentral
Description: This platform helps organizations centralize risk management processes, including service provider assessments and policy adherence tracking.

Name: LogicGate Risk Cloud

Name: Lucidchart
Description: A visual workspace for creating flowcharts, diagrams, and other visualizations to map out data flows across systems and services.

Name: LUKS (Linux)

Name: Mail-Tester.com

Name: ManageEngine ADManager Plus

Name: ManageEngine Endpoint Central

Name: ManageEngine OpManager

Name: ManageEngine Patch Manager Plus
Description: Provides centralized patch management for Windows, macOS, Linux, and third-party applications.

Name: Metasploit
Description: A widely used framework for developing and executing exploit code against a target network, allowing for comprehensive penetration testing.

Name: Microsoft Active Directory
Description: Manages user accounts and permissions across a network, enabling granular control over file system, database, and application access.

Name: Microsoft Active Directory DNS
Description: Integrated with Windows environments, this provides centralized DNS management and authoritative name resolution within the enterprise.

Name: Microsoft Always On VPN

Name: Microsoft Azure - Resource Groups & Subscriptions

Name: Microsoft Azure Active Directory (Azure AD)

Name: Microsoft Azure Purview (formerly Microsoft Information Protection)

Name: Microsoft Configuration Manager (SCCM)

Name: Microsoft Defender for Cloud (Network Security Group)

Name: Microsoft Defender for Endpoint

Name: Microsoft Defender for Endpoint (Vulnerability Assessment)

Name: Microsoft Defender for Office 365

Name: Microsoft Endpoint Manager (formerly Intune)

Name: Microsoft Intune
